Hi Nilesh,
You are correct. I will try putting the class path for
the class file in the class path as well. I must have
missed it when I simplified my original build.xml and
testcase. Hopefully this is the only issue and this
resolves the problem.
thanks for your help.
vijay

--- "Thali, Nilesh" <nilesh.thali@...> wrote:
> I don't see the location of the class(es) being
> tested (TestExample for instance)
> in the classpath
> 
> >   <path id="classpath.base">
> >   </path>
> >   <path id="classpath.test">
> >     <pathelement
> location="e:/junit3.8.1/junit.jar" />
> >     <pathelement location="${tst-dir}" />
> >     <path refid="classpath.base" />
> >   </path>
> 
> which is what it's complaining about:
> 
> >     [junit] TestExample
> >     [junit] java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
> > TestExample
> 
> regards,
> Nilesh
>
